intro: Exacum intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 cm, with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and purple, bloom in spring and summer, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, thriving in humid environments.
